General Utilities (fd_greens.utils.general_utils)

get_statevector(circ_like: Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Iterable[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]], reverse: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Returns the statevector of a quantum circuit.

Parameters

  • circ_like – The circuit or instruction tuples on which the state is to be obtained.

  • reverse – Whether qubit order is reversed.

Returns

The statevector array of the circuit.

get_unitary(circ_like: Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Iterable[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]], reverse: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Returns the unitary of a quantum circuit.

Parameters

  • circ_like – The circuit or instruction tuples on which the unitary is to be obtained.

  • reverse – Whether qubit order is reversed.

Returns

The unitary array of the circuit.

get_overlap(state1: numpy.ndarray, state2: numpy.ndarray) → float[source]

Returns the overlap of two states in either statevector or density matrix form.

Parameters

  • state1 – A 1D or 2D numpy array corresponding to the first state.

  • state2 – A 1D or 2D numpy array corresponding to the second state.

Returns

The overlap between the two states.

reverse_qubit_order(arr: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Reverses qubit order in a 1D or 2D array.

This is because Qiskit uses big endian order and

Parameters

reversed. (The 1D or 2D array on which the qubit order is to be) –

Returns

The 1D or 2D array after qubit order is reversed.

counts_dict_to_arr(counts: Union[qiskit.result.counts.Counts, dict], n_qubits: Optional[int] = None) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Converts bitstring counts from qiskit.result.Counts form to np.ndarray form.

Parameters

  • counts – Bitstring counts either in Counts form or in dict form.

  • n_qubits – The number of qubits. If not passed in, will be extracted from the bitstring counts.

Returns

A numpy array corresponding to the bitstring counts.

circuit_equal(circ1: Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Iterable[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]], circ2: Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Iterable[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]], init_state_0: bool = True) → bool[source]

Checks if two quantum circuits are equivalent.

The two circuits are equivalent either when the unitaries are equal up to a phase or when the statevectors with initial state all 0 are equal up to a phase.

Parameters

  • circ1 – The first quantum cicuit.

  • circ2 – The second quantum circuit.

  • init_state_0 – Whether to assume the initial state is all 0.

Returns

Whether the two circuits are equivalent.

unitary_equal(uni1: numpy.ndarray, uni2: numpy.ndarray, init_state_0: bool = True) → bool[source]

Checks if two unitaries are equal up to a phase factor.

Parameters

  • uni1 – The first unitary.

  • uni2 – The second unitary.

  • init_state_0 – If set to True, only consider equality on the first column corresponding to the all 0 state.

Returns

Whether the two unitaries are equal up to a phase.

vqe_minimize(h_op: qiskit.opflow.primitive_ops.pauli_sum_op.PauliSumOp, ansatz_func: Callable[[Sequence[float]], qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit], init_params: Sequence[float], q_instance: qiskit.utils.quantum_instance.QuantumInstance) → Tuple[float, qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit][source]

Minimizes the energy of a Hamiltonian using VQE.

Parameters

  • h_op – The Hamiltonian operator.

  • ansatz_func – The ansatz function for VQE.

  • init_params – Initial guess parameters.

  • q_instance – The quantum instance for executing the circuits.

Returns

  • energy – The VQE ground state energy.

  • ansatz – The VQE ground state ansatz.
